main event: An unidentified substance was found in Omaha, Nebraska on March 30, 1967, after objects reportedly fell to the ground.
interesting points: The observed objects appeared to be inorganic and opaque forms of a silver gray color., The objects were extremely hot upon landing and one or more disintegrated on impact., Analysis indicated the sample material was formed by a rapid solidification process., A witness, Mr. Morgan, reported finding the particles after they fell and described them as resembling ash., Attempts to identify the source of the particles with local power companies yielded no results.
witness description: Mr. Morgan, approximately 50 years old, stable, cooperative, and not seeking publicity.
